publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-916# Alex Fergusson: Fuel Prices in Rural Scotland-That the Parliament notes with concern the widening gap between fuel prices in urban and rural areas; further notes that between the fuel crisis in September 2000 and summer 2003 the gap remained at a relatively constant two to three pence per litre but has increased since then to a differential of at least six pence per litre, and therefore strongly believes that the Scottish Executive should enter into talks with the major fuel suppliers to ascertain why the differential cannot be maintained at a level that will be less damaging to private, business and tourism interests in rural areas than the current discriminatory level.
S2M-916# Fuel Prices in Rural Scotland (lodged on 13 February 2004) Christine Grahame*, Phil Gallie*
S2M-916# Fuel Prices in Rural Scotland (lodged on 13 February 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*

S2M-916# Fuel Prices in Rural Scotland (lodged on 13 February 2004) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, David Mundell*, Murdo Fraser*, Alex Johnstone*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Alex Neil*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Stewart Stevenson*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Bill Aitken*, John Farquhar Munro*
S2M-916# Fuel Prices in Rural Scotland (lodged on 13 February 2004) John Scott*
S2M-916# Fuel Prices in Rural Scotland (lodged on 13 February 2004) Mr David Davidson*
S2M-916# Fuel Prices in Rural Scotland (lodged on 13 February 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-916# Fuel Prices in Rural Scotland (lodged on 13 February 2004) Ms Sandra White*
S2M-916# Fuel Prices in Rural Scotland (lodged on 13 February 2004) Robin Harper*
S2M-916# Fuel Prices in Rural Scotland (lodged on 13 February 2004) Murray Tosh*
S2M-916# Fuel Prices in Rural Scotland (lodged on 13 February 2004) John Swinburne*
